task.summary: Default task
1. Added separate titles to each plot figure 2. Added wrapper to SEplot with counter used to number the figure 3. commented out SEplot calls in arch_q, garch_pq, linear_regression, and PastAsPresent

1. Renamed arch_model to ArchModelQ because of name conflict with arch_model module and fixed references in arch_q_model 2. Changed import statement in main.py to reflect this 3. Deleted arch_model.py--which was an empty file anyways 4. Added TODO line to rename plots using strings in their respective function calls
1. put plot titles in the functions, 2. deleted empty files 3. Working on PerformanceMeasure class for integration

1. arch_q_model: comment out sklearn import and add to top of file. Added Performance Measure class, also added disp='off' and show_warning=False tags to the model fitting. Change return output to MSE, QL 2. garch_pq_model. Same as 1. 3. Add Performance Measure call 4. Comment out daily_ret line since RetCalc is merged with Volatility class 5. PastasPresent: Same as 3. 6. Performance_Measure: Created performance measure using MSE and QL and added this function to all the models 7. RetCalculator: For the daily calcs, I just merged with Volatility class for simplicity. I will eventually add monthly calcs together here too 8. See 7. In addition, I create a comparison array of returns and volatility. If the returns and volatility for a particular day are zero, then remove this row from the dataframe for daily_vol_result and daily_ret_result

1. added df_single_week to main.py. I also added a TODO to remember to update the scaling factor for the volatility 2. added ability to chunk by week in read_in_files and output df_single_week
error in Volatility.py
error in Volatility.py change to df_single_time for clarity
error in Volatility.py change to df_single_time for clarity change to time_vol_calc function

fixed error: Valueerror: the truth value of a series is ambiguous. for the case that there are no elements with value zero for inters_vol. If inters_ret has no zero vals then it will skip over inters_vol.

1. Added Weekly and Monthly calculations to problem 1 (tn->tn+1) and 2 (LR) 2. Removed RetCalculator 3. Comment out NumDaysWeeksMonths in main.py because the scaling is a constant factor. I do not delete it because it may be useful in the future 4. Plots of SE are now ln(SE), did some preliminary fix to titles of plots 5. General code cleanup 6. The code runs much faster now. NumDaysWeeksMonths was a bottleneck
